member.summary: Matrix-vector multiplication y = alpha * op(A) * x + beta * y, where A is a sparse matrix in CSR storage format, x and y are dense vectors.
member.param: the operation op(A).
number of rows of matrix A.
number of columns of matrix A.
scalar used for multiplication.

the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix types are CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL, CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_SYMMETRIC, and CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_HERMITIAN. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m)-csrRowPtrA(0)) non-zero elements of matrix A.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of csrColIndA gives the number nzz passed to CUSPARSE.
vector of n elements if op(A) = A, and m elements if op(A) = AT or op(A) = AH.
scalar used for multiplication. If beta is zero, y does not have to be a valid input.
vector of m elements if op(A) = A and n elements if op(A) = AT or op(A) = AH.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Csrsv2ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseCsrsv2Info,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
If the returned error code is CUSPARSE_STATUS_ZERO_PIVOT, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero. Otherwise position=-1.
The position can be 0-based or 1-based, the same as the matrix.
Function cusparseXcsrsv2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains structural zero or numerical zero if the user already called csrsv2_analysis() or csrsv2_solve().
if no structural or numerical zero, position is -1; otherwise, if A(j,j) is missing or U(j,j) is zero, position=j.
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Csrsv2ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseCsrsv2Info,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
If the returned error code is CUSPARSE_STATUS_ZERO_PIVOT, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero. Otherwise position=-1.
The position can be 0-based or 1-based, the same as the matrix.
Function cusparseXcsrsv2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains structural zero or numerical zero if the user already called csrsv2_analysis() or csrsv2_solve().
if no structural or numerical zero, position is -1; otherwise, if A(j,j) is missing or U(j,j) is zero, position=j.
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Bsrsv2ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseBsrsv2Info,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
If the returned error code is CUSPARSE_STATUS_ZERO_PIVOT, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero. Otherwise position=-1.
The position can be 0-based or 1-based, the same as the matrix.
Function cusparseXbsrsv2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains structural zero or numerical zero if the user already called bsrsv2_analysis() or bsrsv2_solve().
if no structural or numerical zero, position is -1; otherwise, if A(j,j) is missing or U(j,j) is zero, position=j.
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.summary: Matrix-matrix multiplication C = alpha * op(A) * B + beta * C, where A is a sparse matrix, B and C are dense and usually tall matrices.
member.param: the operation op(A).
number of rows of sparse matrix A.
number of columns of dense matrices B and C.
number of columns of sparse matrix A.
scalar used for multiplication.

the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix types are CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL, CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_SYMMETRIC, and CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_HERMITIAN. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m)-csrRowPtrA(0)) non-zero elements of matrix A.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of csrColIndA gives the number nzz passed to CUSPARSE.
array of dimensions (ldb, n).
leading dimension of B. It must be at least max (1, k) if op(A) = A, and at least max (1, m) otherwise.
scalar used for multiplication. If beta is zero, C does not have to be a valid input.
array of dimensions (ldc, n).
leading dimension of C. It must be at least max (1, m) if op(A) = A and at least max (1, k) otherwise.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Xbsrsm2ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseBsrsm2Info,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
If the returned error code is CUSPARSE_STATUS_ZERO_PIVOT, position=j means A(j,j) is either a structural zero or a numerical zero (singular block). Otherwise position=-1.
The position can be 0-base or 1-base, the same as the matrix. Function cusparseXbsrsm2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains a structural zero or a numerical zero if the user already called bsrsm2_analysis() or bsrsm2_solve().
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Xbsrsm2ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseBsrsm2Info,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:

The position can be 0-base or 1-base, the same as the matrix. Function cusparseXbsrsm2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains a structural zero or a numerical zero if the user already called bsrsm2_analysis() or bsrsm2_solve().
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.summary: This function performs one of the following matrix-matrix operations: C = alpha * op(A) * op(B) + beta * C
member.param: storage format of blocks, either CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.
the operation op(A).
the operation op(B).
number of block rows of sparse matrix A.
number of columns of dense matrix op(B) and A.
number of block columns of sparse matrix A.
number of non-zero blocks of sparse matrix A.
scalar used for multiplication.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of nnzb ( = bsrRowPtrA(mb) - bsrRowPtrA(0) ) nonzero blocks of matrix A.
integer array of mb + 1elements that contains the start of every block row and the end of the last block row plus one.
integer array of nnzb ( =bsrRowPtrA(mb) - bsrRowPtrA(0) ) column indices of the nonzero blocks of matrix A.
block dimension of sparse matrix A, larger than zero.
array of dimensions (ldb, n) if op(B)=B and (ldb, k) otherwise.
leading dimension of B. If op(B)=B, it must be at least max(l,k) If op(B) != B, it must be at least max(1, n).
scalar used for multiplication. If beta is zero, C does not have to be a valid input.
array of dimensions (ldc, n).
leading dimension of C. It must be at least max(l,m) if op(A)=A and at least max(l,k) otherwise.

member.summary:
This function computes the incomplete-LU factorization with 0 fill-in and no pivoting
op(A) ≈ LU
where A is m*n sparse matrix (that is defined in CSR storage format by the three arrays csrValM, csrRowPtrA and csrColIndA).
Notice that the diagonal of lower triangular factor L is unitary and need not be stored. Therefore the input matrix is ovewritten with the resulting lower and upper triangular factor L and U, respectively.
A call to this routine must be preceeded by a call to the csrsv_analysis routine. This function requires some extra storage. It is executed asynchronously with respect to the host and it may return control to the application on the host before the result is ready.
member.param: the operation op(A).
number of rows and columns of matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of csrColIndA gives the number nzz passed to CUSPARSE.
array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) non-zero elements of matrix A.
structure with information collected during the analysis phase (that should have been passed to the solve phase unchanged).

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Csrilu02NumericBoost(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.csrilu02Info,System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Double},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single})
member.summary:
The user can use a boost value to replace a numerical value in incomplete LU factorization. The tol is used to determine a numerical zero, and the boost_val is used to replace a numerical zero. The behavior is
if tol >= fabs(A(j,j)), then A(j,j)=boost_val.
To enable a boost value, the user has to set parameter enable_boost to 1 before calling csrilu02(). To disable a boost value, the user can call csrilu02_numericBoost() again with parameter enable_boost=0.
If enable_boost=0, tol and boost_val are ignored.
member.param: structure initialized using cusparseCreateCsrilu02Info().
disable boost by enable_boost=0; otherwise, boost is enabled.
tolerance to determine a numerical zero.
boost value to replace a numerical zero.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Csrilu02ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseCsrilu02Info,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
If the returned error code is CUSPARSE_STATUS_ZERO_PIVOT, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero. Otherwise position=-1.
The position can be 0-based or 1-based, the same as the matrix.
Function cusparseXcsrsv2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains structural zero or numerical zero if the user already called csrsv2_analysis() or csrsv2_solve().
if no structural or numerical zero, position is -1; otherwise, if A(j,j) is missing or U(j,j) is zero, position=j.
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Csrilu02ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseCsrilu02Info,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
If the returned error code is CUSPARSE_STATUS_ZERO_PIVOT, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero. Otherwise position=-1.
The position can be 0-based or 1-based, the same as the matrix.
Function cusparseXcsrsv2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains structural zero or numerical zero if the user already called csrsv2_analysis() or csrsv2_solve().
if no structural or numerical zero, position is -1; otherwise, if A(j,j) is missing or U(j,j) is zero, position=j.
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Bsrilu02NumericBoost(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.bsrilu02Info,System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Double},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single})
member.summary:
The user can use a boost value to replace a numerical value in incomplete LU factorization. The tol is used to determine a numerical zero, and the boost_val is used to replace a numerical zero. The behavior is
if tol >= fabs(A(j,j)), then A(j,j)=boost_val.
To enable a boost value, the user has to set parameter enable_boost to 1 before calling bsrilu02(). To disable a boost value, the user can call bsrilu02_numericBoost() again with parameter enable_boost=0.
If enable_boost=0, tol and boost_val are ignored.
member.param: structure initialized using cusparseCreateBsrilu02Info().
disable boost by enable_boost=0; otherwise, boost is enabled.
tolerance to determine a numerical zero.
boost value to replace a numerical zero.

member.summary:
This function computes the incomplete-Cholesky factorization with 0 fill-in and no pivoting
op(A) ≈ R'R
where A is m*n Hermitian/symmetric positive definite sparse matrix (that is defined in CSR storage format by the three arrays csrValM, csrRowPtrA and csrColIndA).
Notice that only a lower or upper Hermitian/symmetric part of the matrix A is actually stored. It is overwritten by the lower or upper triangular factor R' or R, respectively.
A call to this routine must be preceeded by a call to the csrsv_analysis routine. This function requires some extra storage. It is executed asynchronously with respect to the host and it may return control to the application on the host before the result is ready.
member.param: the operation op(A).
number of rows and columns of matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of csrColIndA gives the number nzz passed to CUSPARSE.
array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) non-zero elements of matrix A.
structure with information collected during the analysis phase (that should have been passed to the solve phase unchanged).

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Csric02ZeroPivot(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseCsric02Info,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
If the returned error code is CUSPARSE_STATUS_ZERO_PIVOT, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero. Otherwise position=-1.
The position can be 0-based or 1-based, the same as the matrix.
Function cusparseXcsrsv2_zeroPivot() is a blocking call. It calls cudaDeviceSynchronize() to make sure all previous kernels are done.
The position can be in the host memory or device memory. The user can set the proper mode with cusparseSetPointerMode().
member.param: info contains structural zero or numerical zero if the user already called csrsv2_analysis() or csrsv2_solve().
if no structural or numerical zero, position is -1; otherwise, if A(j,j) is missing or U(j,j) is zero, position=j.
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

if no structural or numerical zero, position is -1; otherwise, if A(j,j) is missing or U(j,j) is zero, position=j.
member.returns: If true, position=j means A(j,j) has either a structural zero or a numerical zero; otherwise, position=-1.

member.summary: This function returns size of buffer used in computing the incomplete-Cholesky factorization with fill-in and no pivoting: A = LL^H
member.param: number of rows of matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_TRIANGULAR and diagonal types CUSPARSE_DIAG_TYPE_UNIT and CUSPARSE_DIAG_TYPE_NON_UNIT.
array of nnz (= bsrRowPtrA(m)-bsrRowPtrA(0)) non-zero elements of matrix A.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz (= bsrRowPtrA(m) - bsrRowPtrA(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of bsrColIndA gives the number nzz passed to CUSPARSE.
record of internal states based on different algorithms.
block dimension of sparse matrix A, larger than zero.
storage format of blocks, either CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Gtsv(System.Int32,System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},System.Int32)
member.summary: Solution of tridiagonal linear system A * B = B, with multiple right-hand-sides. The coefficient matrix A is composed of lower (dl), main (d) and upper (du) diagonals, and the right-hand-sides B are overwritten with the solution.
member.param: the size of the linear system (must be >= 3).
number of right-hand-sides, columns of matrix B.
dense array containing the lower diagonal of the tri-diagonal linear system. The first element of each lower diagonal must be zero.
dense array containing the main diagonal of the tri-diagonal linear system.
dense array containing the upper diagonal of the tri-diagonal linear system. The last element of each upper diagonal must be zero.
dense right-hand-side array of dimensions (ldb, m).
leading dimension of B (that is >= max(1;m)).

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.GtsvStridedBatch(System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Solution of a set of tridiagonal linear systems A * x = x, each with a single right-hand-side. The coefficient matrices A are composed of lower (dl), main (d) and upper (du) diagonals and stored separated by a batchStride, while the right-hand-sides x are also separated by a batchStride.
member.param: the size of the linear system (must be >= 3).

dense array containing the lower diagonal of the tri-diagonal linear system. The lower diagonal dl(i) that corresponds to the ith linear system starts at location dl + batchStride * i in memory. Also, the first element of each lower diagonal must be zero.
dense array containing the main diagonal of the tri-diagonal linear system. The main diagonal d(i) that corresponds to the ith linear system starts at location d + batchStride * i in memory.

dense array containing the upper diagonal of the tri-diagonal linear system. The upper diagonal du(i) that corresponds to the ith linear system starts at location du + batchStride * i in memory. Also, the last element of each upper diagonal must be zero.
dense array that contains the right-hand-side of the tridiagonal linear system. The right-hand-side x(i) that corresponds to the ith linear system starts at location x + batchStride * i in memory.
Number of systems to solve.
stride (number of elements) that separates the vectors of every system (must be at least m).

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Nnz(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseDirection,System.Int32,System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseMatrixDescriptor,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32},System.Int32@)
member.summary: This routine finds the total number of non-zero elements and the number of non-zero elements per row or column in the dense matrix A.
member.param: direction that specifies whether to count non-zero elements by CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.
number of rows of matrix A.
number of columns of matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of dimensions (lda, n).
leading dimension of dense array A.
Output: array of size m or n containing the number of non-zero elements per row or column, respectively.
Output: total number of non-zero elements in device or host memory.

partitioning method to be used in the conversion (please refer to cusparseHybPartition_t on page 15 for details).

member.summary:
This function performs following matrix-matrix operation
C = op(A) * op(B)
where op(A), op(B) and C are m x k, k x n, and m x n sparse matrices (defined in CSR storage format by the three arrays csrValA|csrValB|csrValC, csrRowPtrA|csrRowPtrB|csrRowPtrC, and csrColIndA|csrColIndB|csrcolIndC) respectively.
Only support devices of compute capability 2.0 or above.
member.param: the operation op(A).
the operation op(B).
number of rows of sparse matrix op(A) and C.
number of columns of sparse matrix op(B) and C.
number of columns/rows of sparse matrix op(A) / op(B).
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_ MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
integer array of ~m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one. ~m = m if transA == CUSPARSE_ OPERATION_NON_TRANSPOSE, otherwise ~m = k.
integer array of nnzA column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of csrColIndA gives the number nzzA passed to CUSPARSE.
the descriptor of matrix B. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
integer array of ~k + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one. ~k = k if transB == CUSPARSE_ OPERATION_NON_TRANSPOSE, otherwise ~k = n.
integer array of nnzB column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix B. Length of csrColIndB gives the number nzzB passed to CUSPARSE.
the descriptor of matrix C. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.

member.summary:
This function performs following matrix-matrix operation
C = alpha * A + beta * B
where A, B and C are m x n sparse matrices (defined in CSR storage format by the three arrays csrValA|csrValB|csrValC, csrRowPtrA|csrRowPtrB|csrRowPtrC, and csrColIndA|csrColIndB|csrcolIndC respectively), and alpha and beta are scalars. Since A and B have different sparsity patterns, CUSPARSE adopts two-step approach to complete sparse matrix C.
member.param: number of rows of sparse matrix A,B,C.
number of columns of sparse matrix A,B,C.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_ MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnzA column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of csrColIndA gives the number nzzA passed to CUSPARSE.
the descriptor of matrix B. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnzB column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix B. Length of csrColIndB gives the number nzzB passed to CUSPARSE.
the descriptor of matrix C. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.

where A, B and C are m x n sparse matrices (defined in CSR storage format by the three arrays csrValA|csrValB|csrValC, csrRowPtrA|csrRowPtrB|csrRowPtrC, and csrColIndA|csrColIndB|csrcolIndC respectively), and alpha and beta are scalars. Since A and B have different sparsity patterns, CUSPARSE adopts two-step approach to complete sparse matrix C.
member.param: number of rows of sparse matrix A,B,C.
number of columns of sparse matrix A,B,C.
scalar used for multiplication.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_ MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
array of nnzA non-zero elements of matrix A.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnzA column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A. Length of csrColIndA gives the number nzzA passed to CUSPARSE.
scalar used for multiplication.
the descriptor of matrix B. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
array of nnzB non-zero elements of matrix B.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnzB column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix B. Length of csrColIndB gives the number nzzB passed to CUSPARSE.
the descriptor of matrix C. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL only.
array of nnzC (= csrRowPtrC(m) - csrRowPtrC(0)) non-zero elements of matrix C.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnzC (= csrRowPtrC(m) - csrRowPtrC(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix C.

member.summary:
This function performs the coloring of the adjacency graph associated with the matrix A stored in CSR format. The coloring is an assignment of colors (integer numbers) to nodes, such that neighboring nodes have distinct colors. An approximate coloring algorithm is used in this routine, and is stopped when a certain percentage of nodes has been colored. The rest of the nodes are assigned distinct colors (an increasing sequence of integers numbers, starting from the last integer used previously). The last two auxiliary routines can be used to extract the resulting number of colors, their assignment and the associated reordering. The reordering is such that nodes that have been assigned the same color are reordered to be next to each other.
The matrix A passed to this routine, must be stored as a general matrix and have a symmetric sparsity pattern. If the matrix is nonsymmetric the user should pass A+A^T as a parameter to this routine.
member.param: number of rows of matrix A.
number of nonzero elements of matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) nonzero elements of matrix A.
integer array of m+1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz csrRowPtrA(m) csrRowPtrA(0) column indices of the nonzero elements of matrix A.
fraction of nodes to be colored, which should be in the interval [0.0,1.0], for example 0.8 implies that 80 percent of nodes will be colored.
The number of distinct colors used (at most the size of the matrix, but likely much smaller).
The resulting coloring permutation.
The resulting reordering permutation (untouched if NULL)
structure with information to be passed to the coloring.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.Hyb2csr(ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseMatrixDescriptor,ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseHybMat,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Single},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This function converts a sparse matrix in HYB format into a sparse matrix in CSR format.
This function requires some amount of temporary storage. It is executed asynchronously with respect to the host and it may return control to the application on the host before the result is ready.
member.param: the descriptor of matrix in Hyb format. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL.
the matrix A in HYB storage format
array of nnz csrRowPtrA(m) csrRowPtrA(0) non-zero elements of matrix A
integer array of m+1 elements that contains the start of every column and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz csrRowPtrA(m) csrRowPtrA(0) column indices of the nonzero elements of matrix .

member.summary: This function converts a sparse matrix in CSR format (that is defined by the three arrays csrValA, csrRowPtrA and csrColIndA) into a sparse matrix in BSR format (that is defined by arrays bsrValC, bsrRowPtrC, and bsrColIndC). A is m x n sparse matrix and C is (mb*blockDim) x (nb*blockDim) sparse matrix.
member.param: storage format of blocks, either CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.
number of rows of sparse matrix A.
number of columns of sparse matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A.
block dimension of sparse matrix A. The range of blockDim is between 1 and min(m, n).
the descriptor of matrix C.
integer array of mb+1 elements that contains the start of every block row and the end of the last block row plus one.

member.summary: This function converts a sparse matrix in CSR format (that is defined by the three arrays csrValA, csrRowPtrA and csrColIndA) into a sparse matrix in BSR format (that is defined by arrays bsrValC, bsrRowPtrC, and bsrColIndC). A is m x n sparse matrix and C is (mb*blockDim) x (nb*blockDim) sparse matrix.
member.param: storage format of blocks, either CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.
number of rows of sparse matrix A.
number of columns of sparse matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A.
integer array of m + 1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz (= csrRowPtrA(m) - csrRowPtrA(0)) column indices of the non-zero elements of matrix A.
block dimension of sparse matrix A. The range of blockDim is between 1 and min(m, n).
the descriptor of matrix C.
integer array of mb+1 elements that contains the start of every block row and the end of the last block row plus one.

member.summary:
This function can be seen as the same as csr2csc when regarding each block of size rowBlockDim*colBlockDim as a scalar.
This sparsity pattern of result matrix can also be seen as the transpose of the original sparse matrix but memory layout of a block does not change.
The user must know the size of buffer required by gebsr2gebsc by calling gebsr2gebsc_bufferSizeExt, allocate the buffer and pass the buffer pointer to gebsr2gebsc.
member.param: number of block rows of sparse matrix A.
number of block columns of sparse matrix A.
number of nonzero blocks of matrix A.
array of nnzb*rowBlockDim*colBlockDim non-zero elements of matrix A.
integer array of mb+1 elements that contains the start of every block row and the end of the last block row plus one.
integer array of nnzb column indices of the nonzero blocks of matrix A.
number of rows within a block of A.
number of columns within a block of A.
array of nnzb*rowBlockDim*colBlockDim non-zero elements of matrix A. It is only filled-in if copyValues is set to CUSPARSE_ACTION_NUMERIC.
integer array of nnzb row indices of the non-zero blocks of matrix A
integer array of nb+1 elements that contains the start of every block column and the end of the last block column plus one.
CUSPARSE_ACTION_SYMBOLIC or CUSPARSE_ACTION_NUMERIC.
CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO or CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
buffer allocated by the user, the size is return by gebsr2gebsc_bufferSizeExt.

member.summary:
This function converts a sparse matrix in general BSR format (that is defined by the three arrays bsrValA, bsrRowPtrA, and bsrColIndA) into a sparse matrix in CSR format (that is defined by arrays csrValC, csrRowPtrC, and csrColIndC).
Let m(=mb*rowBlockDim) be number of rows of A and n(=nb*colBlockDim) be number of columns of A, then A and C are m*n sparse matrices. General BSR format of A contains nnzb(=bsrRowPtrA[mb] - bsrRowPtrA[0]) non-zero blocks whereas sparse matrix A contains nnz(=nnzb*rowBlockDim*colBockDim) elements. The user must allocate enough space for arrays csrRowPtrC, csrColIndC and csrValC. The requirements are
csrRowPtrC of m+1 elements,
csrValC of nnz elements, and
csrColIndC of nnz elements.
member.param: storage format of blocks, either CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.
number of block rows of sparse matrix A.
number of block columns of sparse matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
integer array of mb+1 elements that contains the start of every block row and the end of the last block row plus one of matrix A.
integer array of nnzb column indices of the nonzero blocks of matrix A.
number of rows within a block of A.
number of columns within a block of A.
the descriptor of matrix C. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
integer array of m+1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one of matrix C.
integer array of nnz column indices of the nonzero elements of matrix C.

member.summary:
This function converts a sparse matrix in general BSR format (that is defined by the three arrays bsrValA, bsrRowPtrA, and bsrColIndA) into a sparse matrix in CSR format (that is defined by arrays csrValC, csrRowPtrC, and csrColIndC).
Let m(=mb*rowBlockDim) be number of rows of A and n(=nb*colBlockDim) be number of columns of A, then A and C are m*n sparse matrices. General BSR format of A contains nnzb(=bsrRowPtrA[mb] - bsrRowPtrA[0]) non-zero blocks whereas sparse matrix A contains nnz(=nnzb*rowBlockDim*colBockDim) elements. The user must allocate enough space for arrays csrRowPtrC, csrColIndC and csrValC. The requirements are
csrRowPtrC of m+1 elements,
csrValC of nnz elements, and
csrColIndC of nnz elements.
member.param: storage format of blocks, either CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.
number of block rows of sparse matrix A.
number of block columns of sparse matrix A.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of nnzb*rowBlockDim*colBlockDim non-zero elements of matrix A.
integer array of mb+1 elements that contains the start of every block row and the end of the last block row plus one of matrix A.
integer array of nnzb column indices of the nonzero blocks of matrix A.
number of rows within a block of A.
number of columns within a block of A.
the descriptor of matrix C. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of nnz non-zero elements of matrix C.
integer array of m+1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one of matrix C.
integer array of nnz column indices of the nonzero elements of matrix C.

member.summary:
This function performs the matrix-vector operation
y = alpha * op(A) * x + beta * y
where A is (mb*blockDim) x (nb*blockDim) sparse matrix (that is defined in BSR storage format by the three arrays bsrVal, bsrRowPtr, and bsrColInd), x and y are vectors, alpha and beta are scalars.
member.param: storage format of blocks, either CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_ROW or CUSPARSE_DIRECTION_COLUMN.
the operation op(A). Only CUSPARSE_OPERATION_NON_TRANSPOSE is supported.
number of block rows of matrix A.
number of block columns of matrix A.
scalar used for multiplication.
the descriptor of matrix A. The supported matrix type is CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL. Also, the supported index bases are CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ZERO and CUSPARSE_INDEX_BASE_ONE.
array of nnzb (= bsrRowPtr(mb) - bsrRowPtr(0)) non-zero blocks of matrix A.
integer array of mb+1 elements that contains the start of every block row and the end of the last block row plus one.
integer array of nnzb (= bsrRowPtr(m) - bsrRowPtr(0)) column indices of the non-zero blocks of matrix A. Length of bsrColIndA gives the number nzzb passed to CUSPARSE.
block dimension of sparse matrix A, larger than zero.
vector of nb*blockDim elements.
scalar used for multiplication. If beta is zero, y does not have to be a valid input.
vector of mb*blockDim element.

block dimension of sparse matrix A, larger than zero.
vector of nb*blockDim elements.
scalar used for multiplication. If beta is zero, y does not have to be a valid input.
vector of mb*blockDim element.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.CreateIdentityPermutation(System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This function creates an identity map. The output parameter p represents such map by p = 0:1:(n-1).
This function is typically used with coosort, csrsort, cscsort, csr2csc_indexOnly.
member.param: size of the map.
integer array of dimensions n.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.CoosortBufferSize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This function sorts COO format. The stable sorting is in-place. Also the user can sort by row or sort by column.
A is an m x n sparse matrix that is defined in COO storage format by the three arrays cooVals, cooRows, and cooCols.
The matrix must be base 0.
member.param: number of rows of matrix A.
number of columns of matrix A.
number of nonzero elements of matrix A.
integer array of nnz unsorted row indices of A.
integer array of nnz unsorted column indices of A.
member.returns: number of bytes of the buffer.

member.summary:
This function sorts COO format. The stable sorting is in-place. Also the user can sort by row or sort by column.
A is an m x n sparse matrix that is defined in COO storage format by the three arrays cooVals, cooRows, and cooCols.
The matrix must be base 0.
member.param: number of rows of matrix A.
number of columns of matrix A.
number of nonzero elements of matrix A.
integer array of nnz unsorted row indices of A.
integer array of nnz unsorted column indices of A.
integer array of nnz sorted map indices.
buffer allocated by the user; the size is returned by CoosortBufferSize().

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.CudaSparseContext.CsrsortBufferSize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32},ManagedCuda.CudaDeviceVariable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
This function sorts CSR format. The stable sorting is in-place.
The matrix type is regarded as CUSPARSE_MATRIX_TYPE_GENERAL implicitly. In other words, any symmetric property is ignored.
This function csrsort() requires buffer size returned by csrsort_bufferSizeExt().
The address of pBuffer must be multiple of 128 bytes. If not, CUSPARSE_STATUS_INVALID_VALUE is returned.
The parameter P is both input and output. If the user wants to compute sorted csrVal, P must be set as 0:1:(nnz-1) before csrsort(), and after csrsort(), new sorted value array satisfies csrVal_sorted = csrVal(P).
member.param: number of rows of matrix A.
number of columns of matrix A.
number of nonzero elements of matrix A.
integer array of m+1 elements that contains the start of every row and the end of the last row plus one.
integer array of nnz unsorted column indices of A.
member.returns: number of bytes of the buffer.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus
member.summary: This is a status type returned by the library functions and it can have the following values.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.Success
member.summary: The operation completed successfully.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.NotInitialized
member.summary: "The CUSPARSE library was not initialized. This is usually caused by the lack of a prior cusparseCreate() call, an error in the CUDA Runtime API called by the CUSPARSE routine, or an error in the hardware setup. To correct: call cusparseCreate() prior to the function call; and check that the hardware, an appropriate version of the driver, and the CUSPARSE library are correctly installed.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.AllocFailed
member.summary: "Resource allocation failed inside the CUSPARSE library. This is usually caused by a cudaMalloc() failure. To correct: prior to the function call, deallocate previously allocated memory as much as possible.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.InvalidValue
member.summary: "An unsupported value or parameter was passed to the function (a negative vector size, for example). To correct: ensure that all the parameters being passed have valid values.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.ArchMismatch
member.summary: "The function requires a feature absent from the device architecture; usually caused by the lack of support for atomic operations or double precision. To correct: compile and run the application on a device with appropriate compute capability, which is 1.1 for 32-bit atomic operations and 1.3 for double precision.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.MappingError
member.summary: "An access to GPU memory space failed, which is usually caused by a failure to bind a texture. To correct: prior to the function call, unbind any previously bound textures.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.ExecutionFailed
member.summary: "The GPU program failed to execute. This is often caused by a launch failure of the kernel on the GPU, which can be caused by multiple reasons. To correct: check that the hardware, an appropriate version of the driver, and the CUSPARSE library are correctly installed.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.InternalError
member.summary: "An internal CUSPARSE operation failed. This error is usually caused by a cudaMemcpyAsync() failure. To correct: check that the hardware, an appropriate version of the driver, and the CUSPARSE library are correctly installed. Also, check that the memory passed as a parameter to the routine is not being deallocated prior to the routine’s completion.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseStatus.MatrixTypeNotSupported
member.summary: "The matrix type is not supported by this function. This is usually caused by passing an invalid matrix descriptor to the function. To correct: check that the fields in cusparseMatDescr_t descrA were set correctly.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparsePointerMode
member.summary: This type indicates whether the scalar values are passed by reference on the host or device. It is important to point out that if several scalar values are passed by reference in the function call, all of them will conform to the same single pointer mode. The pointer mode can be set and retrieved using and routines, respectively.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparsePointerMode.Host
member.summary: Use host pointers.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparsePointerMode.Device
member.summary: Use device pointers.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseAction
member.summary: This type indicates whether the operation is performed only on indices or on data and indices.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseAction.Symbolic
member.summary: the operation is performed only on indices.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseAction.Numeric
member.summary: the operation is performed on data and indices.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseMatrixType
member.summary: This type indicates the type of matrix stored in sparse storage. Notice that for symmetric, Hermitian and triangular matrices only their lower or upper part is assumed to be stored.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseMatrixType.General
member.summary: the matrix is general.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseMatrixType.Symmetric
member.summary: the matrix is symmetric.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseMatrixType.Hermitian
member.summary: the matrix is Hermitian.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseMatrixType.Triangular
member.summary: the matrix is triangular.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseFillMode
member.summary: This type indicates if the lower or upper part of a matrix is stored in sparse storage.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseFillMode.Lower
member.summary: the lower triangular part is stored.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseFillMode.Upper
member.summary: the upper triangular part is stored.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseDiagType
member.summary: This type indicates if the matrix diagonal entries are unity. The diagonal elements are always assumed to be present, but if CUSPARSE_DIAG_TYPE_UNIT is passed to an API routine, then the routine will assume that all diagonal entries are unity and will not read or modify those entries. Note that in this case the routine assumes the diagonal entries are equal to one, regardless of what those entries are actuall set to in memory.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseDiagType.NonUnit
member.summary: the matrix diagonal has non-unit elements.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseDiagType.Unit
member.summary: the matrix diagonal has unit elements.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseIndexBase
member.summary: This type indicates if the base of the matrix indices is zero or one.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseIndexBase.Zero
member.summary: the base index is zero.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseIndexBase.One
member.summary: the base index is one.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseOperation
member.summary: This type indicates which operations need to be performed with the sparse matrix.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseOperation.NonTranspose
member.summary: the non-transpose operation is selected.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseOperation.Transpose
member.summary: the transpose operation is selected.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseOperation.ConjugateTranspose
member.summary: the conjugate transpose operation is selected.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseDirection
member.summary: This type indicates whether the elements of a dense matrix should be parsed by rows or by columns (assuming column-major storage in memory of the dense matrix).

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseDirection.Row
member.summary: the matrix should be parsed by rows.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseDirection.Column
member.summary: the matrix should be parsed by columns.

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseHybPartition
member.summary:
This type indicates how to perform the partitioning of the matrix into regular (ELL) and irregular (COO) parts of the HYB format.
The partitioning is performed during the conversion of the matrix from a dense or sparse format into the HYB format and is governed by the following rules. When CUSPARSE_HYB_PARTITION_AUTO is selected, the CUSPARSE library automatically decides how much data to put into the regular and irregular parts of the HYB format. When CUSPARSE_HYB_PARTITION_USER is selected, the width of the regular part of the HYB format should be specified by the caller. When CUSPARSE_HYB_PARTITION_MAX is selected, the width of the regular part of the HYB format equals to the maximum number of non-zero elements per row, in other words, the entire matrix is stored in the regular part of the HYB format.
The default is to let the library automatically decide how to split the data.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseHybPartition.Auto
member.summary: the automatic partitioning is selected (default).

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseHybPartition.User
member.summary: the user specified treshold is used.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaSparse.cusparseHybPartition.Max
member.summary: the data is stored in ELL format.
